description:
For generations the Türkiye Devleti and the Balt-Rhein Empire have stood in stern opposition to each other. Then one night, when an imperial minister is found assassinated, the two nations are plunged into a potentially explosive situation. As the generals of Turkiye's council cry for war, Mahmut comes to discover the devious truth behind the assassination. Thus the young pasha's battle for his country, peace, and trust in his fellow man begins!

(Source: Kodansha)

node.description: Sister of [Chika Aji](https://anilist.co/staff/133236/Chika-Aji). Won the rookie award in Shounen Sirus in April 2007.
**Toshiyuki Kanno** is a Japanese character designer, animator, animation supervisor and animation director, affiliated with Studio Live.

SID (シド, Shido) is a Japanese visual kei rock band, formed in 2003 and signed to Ki/oon Records. Formed by Mao, Shinji, Aki and Yūya, they are known for producing anime songs, such as for Fullmetal Alchemist, Bleach, Black Butler or Magi.

__Members:__
- Vocals: Mao (マオ) 
- Guitar: Shinji 
- Bass: Aki (明希) 
- Drums: Yuuya (ゆうや)

[Official Website](http://www.flower-ldh.jp)

Flower was a Japanese girl group under the talent agency LDH JAPAN. They were originally a 4 member dance unit who served as back up dancers for the famous J-pop male group EXILE. Their agency later held an audition for girls in order to find more members for the unit and remodel them as a proper dance and vocal group. Among over 30,000 contestants from all over the nation, 5 girls were chosen to be the winners. Flower debuted as a 9 member girl group in 2011 with the single "Still". Subsequently, they also became one of the groups that formed the supergroup E-girls alongside their sister groups Dream and Happiness.

The group followed a very different and unique style from any other ones. Their main genre of songs was ballad, and their dance genres were lyrical and contemporary. Soon enough, they went on to become one of the most beloved girl groups in both Japan and overseas with their heartrending ballads accompanied by soulful dance moves, coupled with aesthetic music videos and live performances which only spoke of artistry. They found much success in their career with physical CD sells, digital downloads and music chart positions.

Unfortunately, many of the members had to leave the group because of differing ambitions, studies and health issues. In the end, the last few remaining members decided to end activity of the group. Like most of the groups from their agency LDH, the members were divided into vocalists (singers) and performers (dancers).

Vocalists:
Washio Reina
Muto Chiharu
Ichiki Kyoka

Performers:
Mizuno Erina (first leader, choreographer)
Shigetome Manami (second leader, choreographer)
Nakajima Mio (choreographer)
Fujii Shuuka
Sato Harumi
Bando Nozomi

CHEMISTRY(ケミストリー) is a Japanese pop/R&B duo, composed of Yoshikuni Dōchin (堂珍嘉邦), born November 17, 1978) and Kaname Kawabata (川畑要), born January 28, 1979). They were the winners of the Asayan audition (similar to the American Idol series) in 2000 organized by Sony Music Entertainment Japan.

__[Website](https://civi-l-ian.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CIVILIAN_LyuLyu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/civilian_official/) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/koyama_nanou)__

__Introduction:__
Civilian, previously known as Lyu:Lyu and -itsuka-, is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record labels Sony Records (2016–), SPACE SHOWER MUSIC (2013–) and coolism records (2009–), having previously been under Eustoma Records (2016).

__Biography:__
The band was formed by classmates Hidekazu Koyama, Junichi Katou and Kiyoyuki Arita in 2008 under the name -itsuka-, they changed their name to Lyu:Lyu in 2009, and changed their name once again on July 18, 2016 to CIVILIAN.

__Members:__
- [Hidekazu Koyama](https://anilist.co/staff/177198/Hidekazu-Koyama) (小山秀和, コヤマヒデカズ) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Junichi Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/177200/Junichi-Katou) (加藤純市), better known by stage name Junichi (純市, じゅんいち) – bassist, also helps with composition and arrangement
- [Kiyoyuki Arita](https://anilist.co/staff/177199/Kiyoyuki-Arita) (有田清幸, ありたきよゆき) – drummer, also helps with composition and arrangement

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
**Tomonori Ochikoshi** is a Japanese producer. He is affiliated with studio A-1 Pictures.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takuopa)__

**Takuya Matsushita** is a Japanese animation planner and producer.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
